conversation.content:
[gasp loudly] Oh my God. Oh my God, it's actually— [laugh] I can't believe this is real. Front page. My stupid little mushroom packaging idea that everyone said was, what was it... "completely delusional." [bitter] Yeah, that's what Mark called it at the investor meeting. And now look, it's right here, business section, with my face and everything. [very excited] They're calling it revolutionary! 

[sniffle] Sorry, I just... phew, I didn't think this would hit me so hard, you know? All those nights when people would literally laugh— [pause] Actually no, not just laugh, they'd get this look like I was wasting their time. My own dad said I should, um... he said I should "get a real job before it's too late." [very quietly] That one hurt.

[laugh loudly] But here's the thing—I knew. Deep down, I mean, okay maybe not always, there were definitely moments where I thought, hmm, maybe they're right? But mostly I knew this could work. [passionately] Biodegradable packaging that actually grows from agricultural waste! [cheerful] And now Whole Foods wants to meet next week. 

Mom's already called three times. [warm] She's crying happy tears, saying she never doubted me. [chuckle] Which is, er... not exactly how I remember it, but whatever. I'll take it. [extremely happy] We actually did it!

subject: Your entrepreneur idea that everyone called crazy just got featured on the front page of the business section
